DOC.brief_title: A Pilot Study Evaluating Signs Symptoms Seasonal Allergic Rhinoconjunctivitis Following Exposure Allergen BioCube
DOC.criteria: least 18 year age ; female , pregnant nursing ; history ocular nasal allergy positive skin test reaction one allergens test within past 24 month ; history mild persistent , moderate severe asthma within precede 5 year accord National Heart , Blood Lung Institute classification ; compromise lung function ; ocular condition could affect subject 's health study parameter ; presence active ocular sinus infection ; significant nasal condition ; significant illness could expect interfere subject 's health study parameter use specify disallowed medication ( topical , topical ophthalmic , systemic and/or injectable treatment antiallergy therapy ) study appropriate prestudy washout period ; use investigational drug device within 30 day start study concurrently enrol another investigational drug device study within 30 day study ;
